item.title: Nikki Mudarris - Age, Family, Bio
Omokri Sends Warning To PDP, Reveals 'Mistake' That Can Make Tinubu Win
item.description: A former aide to ex-President Goodluck Jonathan, Reno Omokri has warned the Peoples Democratic Party (PDP) against making a mistake that may cost the party the 2023 presidency. According to Omokri, choosing the wrong candidate will automatically mean the ruling All Progressives Congress (APC) will continue in power beyond 2023. Specifically, he pointed out that one of the aspirants, Asiwaju Bola Tinubu has a great chance of picking the APC presidential ticket and if PDP picks a wrong candidate, the opposition party might just have kissed the 2023 presidency goodbye and given the former Lagos State Governor an easy ride.

item.title: Who Plays Wade's New Love Interest, Shannon, on 'The Unicorn'?
item.description: 'The Unicorn' Isn't Natalie Zea's First Time Sharing the Screen With Walton Goggins By Shannon RaphaelPublished Jan. 28 2021, 3:38 p.m. ET Source: CBSThe concept behind the CBS series The Unicorn is that Wade (Walton Goggins) is a highly in-demand prospect for women due to his status as a widower. It's no surprise, then, that the character has had a few love interests since the show debuted in 2019. In Season 1, Wade briefly dates Anna (Sarayu Blue), Lizzie (Christina Moore), Lena (Brittany Ishibashi), Heather (Julie Berman), and Caroline (Betsy Brandt), before ultimately realizing that he needs to properly grieve his late wife, Jill.

item.title: Why Buhari Govt Wont Interfere With Ekweremadu's Trial
item.description: The Attorney General of the Federation and Minister of Justice, Abubakar Malami, has said the Muhammadu Buhari-led government would not interfere in the legal battle involving a former Deputy Senate President, Ike Ekweremadu. Ekweremadu is facing trial in the United Kingdom for alleged conspiracy to facilitate the travel of another person for organ harvesting. UK prosecutors accused the former Deputy Senate President of planning to have the kidney of a 21-year-old man removed so it could be given to their ailing daughter.

item.title: Bola Tinubu Storms Ataoja's Palace For Presidential Bid
item.description: The National Leader of the All Progressives Congress (APC), Asiwaju Bola Tinubu on Friday paid a visit to the Ataoja of Osogbo, Oba Jimoh Olanipekun. Naija News reports that the former Lagos governor who visit the traditional ruler in continuation of his consultation was received by a massive crowd in Osogbo, the Osun State capital. Tinubu, who had in January declared his presidential ambition after a meeting with President Muhammadu Buhari, was joined by Osun Governor, Adegboyega Oyetola and other supporters.

item.title: Why Afenifere Supported PDP's Presidential Candidate In 2015, 2019
item.description: Yoruba socio-political group, Afenifere, on Wednesday, disclosed why it supported the presidential candidate of the Peoples Democratic Party during the 2015 and 2019 general election. The group noted that it supported the candidate of the PDP because its candidates promised that they would restructure Nigeria. The spokesperson of Afenifere, Yinka Odumakin, stated this during an interview with Punch on Wednesday. Odumakin disclosed this when asked if Afenifere had turned to an arm of the PDP.

item.title: What Buhari Told Tinubu After He Informed Him About Contesting 2023 Presidency
item.description: The National Leader of the All Progressives Congress (APC), Asiwaju Bola Tinubu has disclosed President Muhammadu Buhari’s response after he informed him of his 2023 presidential ambition. The APC leader disclosed that President Buhari didn’t object to his 2023 presidential ambition. It will be recalled as earlier reported by Naija News that the former Lagos State Governor on Monday confirmed he has informed President Muhammadu Buhari of his presidential ambition. Tinubu on Monday met with the President behind closed doors at the Aso Rock Villa in Abuja and the two leaders held discussions.

item.title: Average Price Of Diesel Now N716.00 As Petrol Price Surges
item.description: Nigerians according to the National Bureau of Statistics (NBS) now purchase Automotive Gas Oil (Diesel) at an average price tag of N716. The current price was said to have increased by 181.00 per cent from N238.82 in May 2021 to N671.08 recorded in early May 2022. Diesel as of the current survey is sold at a more higher price in states like Ekiti, Osun and Oyo state. On a month-on-month basis the average retail price reportedly increased from N654.

item.title: SCUML registration requirements, guidelines, portal, certificate, offices
item.description: Money laundering is a serious offence in Nigeria because it distorts the economy of the country. It also causes a reduction in the amount of government revenue and erodes the financial sector. For these reasons, the Federal Government of Nigeria established the Special Control Unit against Money Laundering (SCUML). Through the SCUML registration, different organisations across the country can protect themselves against money laundering. What is SCUML? It is an organisation that was established in September 2005 to combat money laundering.

item.title: President Tinubu Pays N12bn Outstanding Debt To Super Eagles, Others
item.description: President Bola Tinubu has approved the payment of N12 billion, which is a backlog of various debts owed to the nation’s national teams, including the Super Eagles. The payment is for members of the national teams, and coaches’ salaries, including allowances and other entitlements running up to 15 months. The payment also covers the female national teams and the under-20 national team. The clearing of the outstanding sums was made known in a statement on Sunday released via the X handle of Tinubu’s Media Centre.

item.title: Lagos Govt Aims To Bring Super Eagles Back To Teslim Balogun Stadium
item.description: Lagos State government hopes to make the Teslim Balogun Stadium the permanent home of the Super Eagles of Nigeria. The last time the Super Eagles played at the Teslim Balogun Stadium was in March 2021 against Lesotho. The game ended 3-0 in favour of the Super Eagles. Teslim Balogun Stadium which is a multi-use stadium is named after a former professional footballer and was constructed in 1984. The stadium is one of the five stadiums across Lagos State that is currently under rehabilitation.

item.title: NANS Issues One Week Ultimatum To FG, ASUU To End Strike
item.description: The National Association of Nigerian Students (NANS) has asked President Muhammadu Buhari-led government to meet the demands of the Academic Staff Union of University (ASUU) to allow students to resume their classes. The student association threatened to embark on nationwide protest should the government fail to end the ongoing strike by doing the needful. NANS President, Sunday Asefon who spoke on Monday in Sokoto State said it won’t be possible that Nigerian students are at home while the office of the Minister of Education and Minister of Labour is open.

item.title: Igbo Group Hails Baba-Ahmed Over Comment On Peter Obi
item.description: The South East Revival Group (SERG) has commended the spokesman of the Northern Elders Forum (NEF), Hakeem Baba-Ahmed over his comment on the Labour Party (LP) presidential flagbearer, Peter Obi. Naija News reports that Baba-Ahmed had in a tweet via his official Twitter handle last Friday announced his meeting with the LP Presidential candidate. The NEF spokesman commended the former Anambra State Governor for his zeal to fix the country and asked those who try to sell him will tone down his ethnic identity.

item.title: IPOB/ESN Leader, Nnamdi Arrested In Enugu
item.description: Security operatives have arrested a leader of Indigenous People of Biafra (IPOB) militia, Eastern Security Network (ESN), Godwin Nnamdi. Naija News reports that this was made known in a statement on Sunday by the Nigerian Army spokesperson, Brig. Gen. Onyeama Nwachukwu. He stated that troops of the 82 Division led the operation to arrest the notorious Nnamdi in Nkanu East Local Government Area. He disclosed that Nnamdi was caught when troops engaged the terrorists during the raid at a IPOB/ESN camp located at Akpowfu Forest in Nkanu East LGA.

item.title: Herdsmen: Benue Anti-grazing Law Won't Be Repealed
item.description: Governor Samuel Ortom of Benue State has maintained that his administration would not repeal the anti-grazing law in the state. The Benue governor stated this on Saturday during a media parley to celebrate his second year in office. Recall that Ortom had on May 22, 2017, signed the Benue anti-grazing law that prohibits the movement of livestock on foot within the state — following a series of clashes between herders and farmers.

item.title: SDP National Chairman, Olu Agunloye Resigns
item.description: The National Chairman of the Social Democratic Party (SDP), Dr Olu Agunloye, has officially resigned from his position, with immediate effect. In a chat with reporters on Wednesday in Abuja, Agunloye said his resignation was to respect the zoning arrangement in the party. He disclosed that the party has zoned its 2023 presidential ticket to the South, stressing that all positions held by Southerners are now zoned to the North.

item.title: N42 Billion Debt: Dead Bodies Are Decomposing In Army Mortuaries
item.description: Corpses in mortuaries in several Nigerian Army bases are reportedly decomposing due to the ongoing power outage, according to Chief of Army Staff Lt Gen Taoreed Lagbaja. item.title: Injured Bolt out until mid-June
item.description: Jamaican sprinter and Usain Bolt, who has suffered a foot injury, will not race again until mid-June at the Ostrava meeting in the Czech Republic. Confirming this, his agent Ricky Simms said, "At the moment, we have confirmed the presence of Usain at Ostrava, Paris and Malmo. We will announce other dates soon." In spite of this setback, Simms said that Bolt will still train from next week. The Ostrava meeting takes place on June 17 with Paris on July 5 and Malmo on August 5.

Recall that Governor Aminu Waziri Tambuwal of Sokoto State, Governor Bala Mohammed, Dr. Bukola Saraki, and Mohammed Hayatu-Deen had criss-crossed the country hoping to pick a consensus candidate amongst themselves ahead of the PDP presidential primaries.

item.title: 'My Father Never Wanted To Be Tinubu's Minister' Bello El-Rufai
item.description: The lawmaker representing Kaduna North Federal Constituency in the House of Representatives, Bello El-Rufai, in an enlightening conversation with Seun Okinbaloye on Saturday, shared insights into the sentiments of his father, the former Governor of Kaduna State, Nasir El-Rufai, regarding his recent ministerial nomination by President Bola Tinubu. According to Bello, his father had no initial desire for a ministerial position and viewed the Senate’s rejection of his nomination as a loss of an effective administrator for Nigeria.

item.title: 2023: How PDP Can Reclaim Presidency from APC
item.description: Former Osun State Governor, Prince Olagunsoye Oyinlola has asked members of the Peoples Democratic Party (PDP) to unite in order to win the 2023 presidential election. Oyinlola gave the advice while speaking with newsmen on Friday after receiving former Oyo State Deputy Governor Taofeek Arapaja and party supporters in his house in Osogbo. He said with unity of purpose, the PDP can rescue Nigerians from the suffering created by the All Progressives Congress misrule.

item.title: President Buhari To Attend Summit In India
item.description: On Tuesday, October 27, President Muhammadu Buhari will leave Abuja for New Delhi, India, to take part in the 3rd Summit of the India-Africa Forum. According to a statement issued by Femi Adesina, the special adviser on media and publicity to the president, on Sunday, October 25, in Abuja, the aim of the summit is to boost socio-economic development in Africa and India. Adesina revealed that President Buhari, the Indian prime minister, Narendra Modi, and other participating heads of state would discuss such important questions as climate change and international terrorism.

item.title: Where Do the Budweiser Clydesdales Live When They Aren't Making Beer Commercials?
item.description: Clydesdales are draught horses originally bred for farm labor. Budweiser Clydesdales just haul beer, but where do they live when they aren't working? Source: Getty ImagesClydesdales are six feet on average from feet to shoulder. Anheuser-Busch owns one of the largest herds of Clydesdales in the world, known as the Budweiser Clydesdales. The beer company has been using the horses, in some capacity, since 1933, when the Busch family presented six Clydesdales to their father, August Busch Sr.

item.title: 368 Grazing Reserves: 'Do Not Be A Fool To Obey Buhari's Directive'
item.description: Former Presidential aide, Reno Omokri, has admonished governors in the Southern region of Nigeria not to become fools in accepting President Muhammadu Buhari’s order for the review of 368 Grazing Reserves in 26 states. His spokesman, Femi Adesina said the development was targeted at curbing farmer and herders crisis rocking some parts of the country.

item.title: Justin Verlander - Age, Family, Bio
item.description: All-Star pitcher who won both the AL MVP and AL Cy Young Award with the Detroit Tigers in 2011. He was named American League Rookie of the Year in 2006 and was selected to the AL All-Star game six times from 2007 to 2013. In 2017, he was traded to the Houston Astros, and he went on to help the Astros claim their first ever World Series title that year.  Before Fame He could throw in the mid-80s by the time he reached high school.

item.title: Kunle Ajayi speaks on music, rising from poor background
item.description: - Seasoned saxophonist and pastor, Kunle Ajayi, speaks on humble beginnings and background in music - Touches on his rough past and how drugs and a notorious environment could have negatively influenced him Ace Nigerian instrumentalist and Pastor, Kunle Ajayi, speaks on past life as a kid in the ghetto, his conversion to Christianity and his journey into music as well as playing the saxophone. In an exclusive interview with Punch, Ajayi talked about growing up in Mushin and attending a primary school in the community.

item.title: Kuwait bans issuance of visas to 5 Muslim countries
item.description: Following the ban placed by President Trump on the nationals of countries with Muslims that he sees as potential threat to the lives and safety of Americans, Kuwait has followed suit by placing bans on citizens of some Islamic countries. It was gathered that the tight entry restrictions were placed as a result of the instability of those countries with the government of Kuwait pledging to lift the bans as soon as the security situation improves.

item.title: LPs Rhodes-Vivour Reacts As Thugs Set Ablaze Spare Parts Market In Lagos
item.description: The Labour Party ( LP) governorship candidate in Lagos State, Gbadebo Rhodes-Vivour (GRV) has condemned the burning of the spare parts market at Kirikiri road Ajegunle, Ajeromi Ifelodun in Lagos by unknown arsonists. Naija News reports that suspected hoodlums at the wee hours of Wednesday 8th, March 2023, attacked the spare parts market, which is mostly dominated by the Igbos. The incident is coming days after some politicians in Lagos State alleged that Igbos plan to take over Lagos through the Labour Party (LP) candidate, Gbadebo Rhodes-Vivour.

item.title: Maya Rudolph Steals Show as Kamala Harris
item.description: Maya Rudolph Throws “Clair Huxtable Side-Eye” in ‘SNL’ 2020 VP Debate SkitBy Dan ClarendonUpdated Oct. 11 2020, 12:18 p.m. ET Source: Will Heath/NBCAfter skewering the first presidential debate in early October, Saturday Night Live offered a hilarious 2020 vice presidential debate skit on the NBC sketch comedy show’s Saturday, Oct. 10, episode. And yes, that fly made a cameo! Maya Rudolph played Kamala Harris, senator of “Kamalafornia”Introducing the skit was SNL cast member Kate McKinnon as debate moderator Susan Page.

item.title: Single Mother of Four Gets Brand New Home from Kind Man
item.description: The mum of four said she was overwhelmed by emotions when she was handed the keys to her new homeThe single mother of four is among the many single mothers who have benefited from the Warrick Dunn CharitiesThe single mum's home is the 194th house the Warrick Dunn Charities gifted single mothersA single mother of four and her children are sleeping a happy lot today after being gifted a brand home.

item.title: UniAbuja portal: login, admission, profile, faculties (2022)
item.description: The University of Abuja is a federal university situated in the heart of Nigeria. It has been in operation for over three decades and currently has a population of more than 55,000 students. The university has developed robust strategies to maintain its status as the model university in Nigeria. If you are eyeing joining the institution, you ought to check out these details about the UniAbuja portal. The University of Abuja is strengthening electronic technology as one of its strategies to become a global institution.

item.title: Valhalla' Connected to 'Vikings'? Here's the Truth
item.description: Is 'Vikings: Valhalla' Connected to 'Vikings'? When Does the New Show Take Place?By Stephanie HarperMar. 8 2022, Published 12:38 p.m. ET Source: NetflixBetween 2013 and 2020, Vikings was the show to watch for people trying to educate themselves on what the lives of history's most interesting group of people were like. Vikings takes place in the late eighth and early ninth centuries. The show is set in the era when Swedish Vikings were beginning to establish themselves in what would eventually become modern Russia, Ukraine, and Belarus.

item.title: What Is Next For Peter Obi As Resignation Letter Goes Viral? [See Photo]
item.description: Former Anambra State governor and Presidential aspirant, Peter Obi has confirmed his resignation from the Peoples Democratic Party (PDP). Peter Obi who was seen as a frontline candidate of the main opposition party quit the PDP officially on Wednesday. In a post on his Twitter handle, the financial expert announced he has left the former ruling party without revealing his next party. I have resigned my membership in the Peoples Democratic Party.

item.title: Why Does George Shea Shake Sometimes During Competitive Eating?
item.description: Competitive Eating Emcee George Shea Sometimes Shakes During Competitions — Why?You'd be shaking too if you heard George Shea's competitive eating commentary. By Callie (Carlos) CadornigaPublished July 4 2024, 8:00 a.m. ET Source: Getty ImagesOne of the biggest and most famous competitions in the U.S. takes place every Independence Day. The annual Nathan's Famous Fourth of July Hot Dog Eating Contest gathers big eaters from all over the world to do exactly what you think they'll be doing: eating more hot dogs than most people can literally stomach.

item.title: You and a Friend Can Play Together Through 'Kirby and the Forgotten Land'
item.description: Along with the announcement of its release date, Nintendo revealed multiplayer details of the upcoming title, 'Kirby and the Forgotten Land.' Source: NintendoIt's been years since there's been a new Kirby game, and as part of Nintendo's 30-year celebration of the franchise, Kirby and the Forgotten Land is set to hit the Nintendo Switch early in 2022. After months of the developers sharing few details about the upcoming title, we now know details about its multiplayer options, release date, and more.
